Entities.Name: RT Event
Entities.Definition: An instance of radiation therapy treatment, including all related properties like dose, fraction frequency, fraction number, date, treatment site, and whether it is a boost or not.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient received 50 Gy in 25 fractions to the pelvic region with an additional boost of 10 Gy to the prostate.
Sample Data.Annotated: RT Event: 50 Gy in 25 fractions to the pelvic region, boost of 10 Gy to the prostate

Entities.Name: Dose
Entities.Definition: The amount of radiation administered, expressed in gray (Gy) units.

Sample Data.Sentence: The treatment plan was to deliver a total of 60 Gy in 30 fractions.

Entities.Name: Fraction Number
Entities.Definition: The number of individual sessions in which the radiation dose is divided.

Sample Data.Sentence: The course consisted of 15 fractions over 3 weeks.

Entities.Name: Treatment Site
Entities.Definition: The anatomical location where radiation is targeted.

Sample Data.Sentence: Radiation was targeted to the left breast.

Entities.Name: Boost
Entities.Definition: Additional radiation given to the treatment site, often after the initial course, to achieve a higher total dose.

Sample Data.Sentence: Post initial treatment, a boost of 16 Gy was administered to the tumor bed.

Dataset.Name: Clinical Radiation Therapy Documents
Dataset.Details: A corpus of 495 documents from various sources including clinical notes and radiation therapy prescriptions, annotated for RT events and their properties.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Detailed guidelines developed for the annotation of radiation therapy events, including properties such as dose, fraction number, treatment site, and boost, all linked to their respective RT event.
